title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1150.9 - Tampering
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1150.9 - Tampering

State Regulations
(a) No person shall
interfere or tamper with any aircraft, watercraft or motor vehicle, or start
the engine of same, or use any parts, instruments or tools unless authorized to
do so. (b) Heater valves, sprinkler
valves and devices, blower motors, fire extinguishers or any other terminal
machinery or equipment shall not be tampered with at any time or used for other
than the intended purpose. (c) Tags
showing the date of last inspection shall be left attached to each
unit. (d) No person other than an
authorized employee shall turn heaters on and off or operate any other terminal
equipment, except in leased areas. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1150.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
